intro: Orthochilus foliosus, commonly known as the leafy orthochilus, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Orthochilus foliosus is native to regions of southern Europe and western Asia, often growing in moist, shaded environments. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental foliage and delicate floral display.
